column5: Back in 2014 our group made a big jump and completed our first fly in Many on this board provided input as well In a word it was epic and have been on 3 since then and are headed out again in 2020 PB walleye were caught, we were stranded in Thessalon and so much more A few quick shots below but you can check the full story herehttps://www.northernjacks.com/post/5...r-first-fly-in Cheers Andrew
Great story Andrew! It is ironic how much went "wrong" on your very first fly-in. Just have to roll with the punches sometimes!!Sent from my SM-A530W using Tapatalk

gordy, thanks for the report. It is very useful for people considering their first fly-in. We have had similar experiences. I usually report on our trips, but one you might find interesting is a thread here on WC called "Short report on Tennant Lake." We actually had a cabin fall off it's foundation! I like your style, it would be great to drop a line with your group! Fish On! Hooks

Thanks guys!Adam for sure - I often tell people that it was so good that even with all of the hardship we have never looked back on doing more lol.HHH - I have read your Tennant report and loved it! I always appreciate the posters who come back and update on their trip. IMO if you visit boards and are constantly asking about this lake or that lake its implied that you will come back and give an update - pay it forward so to speak. Doesn't need to be a novel or include a wealth of awesome pictures but an update that says "fishing good, great outfitter, but not a lot of variety in the lake" is so helpful. I think our groups would get on like fire as wellCheersAndrew
